Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • Driver

  • public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    Main functional Method for Senate Simulator, containing the while loops
    that provide the game and repeating prompt functionality.
    Also the location of most of the actual class interactions.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Driver()

    • Method Detail

      • delay

        public static void delay()
        Creates small delay, and break in text to seperate prompts

      • generateSenate

        public static Senate generateSenate(int year)
        Sets up Senate object as it should be for Driver's functionality.
        Then prints senate to inform the user of its composition.
        Returns:
        senate that is to be interacted with in the Driver loops

      • generateState

        public static State generateState()
        Sets up State object as it should be for Driver's functionality.
        Prompts user to enter state of their choosing for their homeState,
        Then prints homeState to inform the user of its status.
        Returns:
        senate that is to be interacted with in the Driver loops

      • generatePlayer

        public static Player generatePlayer(State homeState)
        creates the Player object that will be going through the game
        Returns:
        the instantiated Player

      • electionTime

        public static boolean electionTime(State playerState,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Legislation> l,
                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> s)
        Helper function to handle elections, and responding to their result.
        Runs popularity(ArrayList, ArrayList) to find election results,
        then prints the appropriate response)
        Parameters:
        playerState - the State that is running popularity(ArrayList, ArrayList)
        l - one parameter for popularity(ArrayList, ArrayList)
        s - other parameter for popularity(ArrayList, ArrayList)
        Returns:
        A true if reelected, a false if removed from office

      • playerChoose

        public static void playerChoose(Senate senate,
                Player player,
                State playerState)
        replaces the delay() method in certain situations;
        Lets the player refer back to the stats of the senate and their homeState to facilitate informed decision-making

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        main(String[]) contains the loops that cause the functionality of Driver.
        while(elected) is overarching loop determining if game is running.
        while(legislationActive) is for while legislation is being voted upon
        while(evenOccuring) is while events are being responeded to
        Three major events occur in each iteration of while(elected);
        Voting on Legislation, responding to Events, checking stats,
        and every three iterations dealing with releection.
        Parameters:
        args - Unused
